channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: A bright spot for turtles: Olive ridleys are recovering in India, but still at risk
item.description: India's olive ridley turtle numbers appear to have rebounded after years of patchwork efforts to stem their decline. Can it last?

item.title: Trump vows to 'permanently pause' migration from poor nations in social media screed
item.description: President Donald Trump vowed on Thanksgiving to "permanently pause migration" from poorer nations in a blistering late-night, anti-immigrant screed po...

item.title: Israeli forces kill Palestinian men in West Bank after they appear to surrender
item.description: Israeli forces on Thursday killed a pair of Palestinian men in the occupied West Bank after they appeared to surrender, drawing Palestinian accusation...

item.title: What will holiday shopping say about the state of America? An expert hunts for clues
item.description: Retail expert Katie Thomas scours her local shopping mall in Pittsburgh to divine what Americans' shopping habits reveal about the economy and the nat...

item.title: The DOT says it wants to make trucking safer, but some see an 'immigration raid'
item.description: The Department of Transportation wants tougher rules for commercial driver's licenses after a deadly crash involving a trucker from India. Critics say...

item.title: Have a CD account set to mature in 2026? Here's what experts recommend doing now.
item.description: If you're nearing the end of your CD term, there are a few simple but important steps you may want to take now.

item.title: Trump says US will pause migration from 'third-world countries'
item.description: The president did not name which countries would be affected, but vowed to remove anyone "not a net asset" to the US.

item.title: Ten killed in deadliest Israeli raid for months in southern Syria
item.description: The village of Beit Jinn came under attack in what Israel said was an operation against a militant group.

item.title: Hong Kong apartment blaze finally doused, but death toll keeps rising
item.description: Hong Kong authorities say almost 130 people have been confirmed dead in the massive fire that charred an apartment complex and took two days to put ou...

item.title: What we know about shooting of National Guard in Washington DC
item.description: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, has died, while Andrew Wolfe, 24, remains in a critical condition.

item.title: Watch: Pope struggles to remove cloth covering plaque
item.description: It took several attemps for Pope Leo and church clergy to unveil a plaque covered by a white sheet at an Istanbul cathedral.

item.title: Guinea-Bissau president flees to Senegal after coup
item.description: Umaro Sissoco Embaló has arrived in Senegal "safe and sound" on a chartered military plane, authorities say.
